original: Bergelin, Sune, överste, Göteborg, f. 9/11/82 i Karlsborg, Skarab. 1., av överste TheodoT B. o. Helena Gentz-schein. G. 11 m. Gunlöd Wikander. Barn: Pehr-Johan f. 13, jur. kand., förste aman. i försv. civ :förvaltn., Sthlm, Sven-Eggert 16, kapt. v. gen:-stabskåren, Sthlm. — Off :ex. 02, AIHS ak 05, hk 10. Und:löjtn. i Göta art:reg. 02, löjtn. 05, kapt. 16, major 26, förordn. öv:löjtn. v. Svea art:reg. 29, öv:löjtn. v. Göta art:reg. 29, chef f. AIHS 30, överste i armén 33, tf. chef f. Bodens art:reg. 34, chef 35, chef f. Göta art:reg. 38-43. Adjut. v. III. arméfördeln. stab 10-12, art:stabs-off. 13-20. Tjg. v. schw^eiziska armén 20, franska armén 22 o. estniska armén 36. Skr.: Världskriget I-III (17, 20, 22), art. i mil. tidskr., medarb. i Gbgs Handels- o. Sjöfartstidn. 23-45, i Gbgs Morgonpost sed. 46, red. f. krigsväsen i Sv. Uppslagsbok (andra uppl). KSOlkl, RNO, EÖK3M, KER-K02kl, KFinlVRO, FSftjk, LKrVA.
translated: Bergelin, Sune, Colonel, Gothenburg, born November 9, 1882 in Karlsborg, Skaraborg county, eldest son of Colonel Theodor B. and Helena Gentzschein. Married in 1911 to Gunlöd Wikander. Children: Pehr-Johan born in 1913, law graduate, first official in defense administration in Stockholm; Sven-Eggert born in 1916, Captain of the General Staff Corps in Stockholm. Graduated from the Officer Candidate School in 1902, Artillery and Engineering Higher School in 1905, and Military Academy in 1910. Promoted to Second Lieutenant in the Gotha Artillery Regiment in 1902, Lieutenant in 1905, Captain in 1916, Major in 1926, Lieutenant Colonel appointed to the Svea Artillery Regiment in 1929, Lieutenant Colonel appointed to the Gotha Artillery Regiment in 1929, Head of the Artillery Institution in 1930, Colonel in the Army in 1933, Acting Head of the Boden Artillery Regiment in 1934, Head in 1935, Head of the Gotha Artillery Regiment from 1938 to 1943. Adjutant to the Army Command of the Third Military Region from 1910 to 1912, Artillery Staff Officer from 1913 to 1920. Served in the Swiss Army in 1920, French Army in 1922, and Estonian Army in 1936. Publications include World War I-III (1917, 1920, 1922), articles in military journals, collaborator of Gothenburg Trade and Shipping News from 1923 to 1945, collaborator of Gothenburg Morning Post since 1946, editor of military affairs in the Swedish Encyclopedia (second edition). Knight of the Royal Order of the Seraphim, Commander of the Royal Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of the Sword (Class 3), Commander of the Finnish Order of the Lion, Swedish Military Sports Badge, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences.

structured.description: Sune Bergelin was a Swedish Colonel born on November 9, 1882 in Karlsborg, Skaraborg County. He was the eldest son of Colonel Theodor B. and Helena Gentzschein. In 1911, he married Gunlöd Wikander and had two children, Pehr-Johan and Sven-Eggert.
